title: Greg Boyd - Christian troublemaker (4 books)
description:
4 books by Gregory A. Boyd, various formats, all good quality.


1. The Myth of a Christian Nation: How the Quest for Political Power Is Destroying the Church (Zondervan, 2007). epub, mobi, pdf

2. The Myth of a Christian Religion: Losing Your Religion for the Beauty of a Revolution (Zondervan, 2009). epub, mobi, pdf


coauthored with Paul Rhodes Eddy:

3. Lord or Legend?: Wrestling With the Jesus Dilemma (Baker, 2007). pdf only; this one seems to be an OCR version, but better than the average OCR text

4. The Jesus Legend: A Case for the Historical Reliability of the Synoptic Jesus Tradition (Baker, 2007). epub, mobi only


about Greg Boyd (from wikipedia):

Gregory A. "Greg" Boyd (born June 2, 1957) is an American theologian, pastor, and author. Boyd is Senior Pastor of Woodland Hills Church in St. Paul, Minnesota and President of Reknew.org. He is well known as a leading advocate of open theism. He is also a noted Christian anarchist and is known for his writings on the relationship between Christianity and politics ... In 2012, Woodland Hills Church began exploring Anabaptism and the possibility of affiliating with Mennonite Church USA and the Brethren in Christ. Boyd stated that "we've really been kind of growing in this direction since the church started, without knowing what Anabaptism was."
